result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:40 PM 
Defendant Randy R. Bobisud appeared by video.  Attorney Tripp Stroud in court for Randy R. Bobisud.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Stroud moves for modification of bond.
State argues timeliness of motion.

Court will hear the motion today.

Attorney Stroud argues cash amount.
State argues against cash amount and informs the court re: possible amended complaint.
Attorney Stroud argues cash amount once again.

Court: Denies the motion for reasons stated on the record

- Defendant may only travel to the State of Illinois to visit family.
- Defendant shall not have contact with children under the age of 18 except for immediate family members and only if supervised by the child's parent.
- Defendant shall only use the internet for communication purposes.
- Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

1:58 PM Defendant Randy R. Bobisud appeared by video.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt appeared by video for Randy R. Bobisud.  Prosecuting attorney Jenna L Gill in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Witt and defendant acknowledge receipt of complaint and waive reading.
Court finds probable cause is stated for filing.
State requests $50,000.00 cash bond with conditions:
- don't leave State of WI
- no use of internet or social media
- no contact with anyone under the age of 18
- no use of controlled substances without a valid prescription

Atty Witt opposes the State's bond request; moves for $500-$1,000 cash; opposes the request for no travel outside the State of WI; opposes the request for no access to the internet; believes defendant should be able to have contact with minors in his family.

Court orders $50,000.00 cash with conditions:
- Defendant may only travel to the State of Illinois to visit family.
- Defendant shall not have contact with children under the age of 18 except for immediate family members and only if supervised by the child's parent.
- Defendant shall only use the internet for communication purposes.
- Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Court informs defendant of right to counsel.
Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Set for adjourned initial 9/23/22 at 3:00 p.m.
